author: Ben Leubsdorf
title: Treasury, Needing Money, Plans to Slowly Boost Debt Auctions
text:
WASHINGTON—The Treasury Department is slowly ramping up its debt auctions to meet the federal government’s growing need for borrowed money.
In all, changes announced Wednesday will mean an additional $27 billion of new issuance for the coming quarter, the department said, driven by the Federal Reserve’s balance-sheet policies as well as the fiscal outlook. The Treasury had announced $42 billion in additional issuance last quarter.
...
